dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3029 IH: Combating the President’s Voter Suppression Commission Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Veasey introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To prevent Federal funds from being used to carry out Executive Order 13799.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the “Combating the President’s Voter Suppression Commission Act”.
The purpose of this Act is to combat federally funded voter discrimination and suppression, which the Presidential Advisory Commission on Election Integrity will undoubtedly lead to.
No Federal funds may be used to carry out Executive Order 13799 (82 Fed. Reg. 22389; establishing the Presidential Advisory Commission on Election Integrity).
